title: Homemade Chocolate Frosting Recipe
description: This homemade chocolate frosting recipe is easy to whip up for a deliciously rich and chocolaty frosting that's perfect for cakes and cupcakes.

recipe is easy to make for creamy homemade chocolate frosting every time! Using melted butter helps to bloom the cocoa powder, creating a more flavorful chocolate frosting. Submitted by Rachel Kane Updated on March 18, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 13 13 13 13 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 20 Yield: 2 1/2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This decadent chocolate frosting recipe is the perfect finishing touch for cakes, cupcakes, brownies, and more.  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios How to Make Chocolate Frosting You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Chocolate Buttercream Ingredients This homemade chocolate frosting recipe comes together quickly with just five ingredients: confectioners’ sugar, cocoa powder, melted butter, milk, and vanilla extract. How to Make Chocolate Buttercream Frosting Simply beat all the ingredients together until they are smooth and creamy. That’s it! You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below.  Recipe Tips Here are some expert tips from our test kitchen professionals:If you want a richer frosting use half & half or cream instead of milk.To make an espresso-flavored chocolate frosting, add 1 teaspoon espresso powder. How Much Frosting Does This Recipe Make? This chocolate frosting recipe yields about 2 ½ cups, which is the perfect amount for frosting an average cake or about two dozen cupcakes. You can easily double the recipe if you need more.  How to Use Chocolate Frosting Ready to put your homemade chocolate frosting to good use? Try one of these top-rated cake recipes that pair perfectly with chocolate frosting:  Yellow Cake Made From Scratch One Bowl Chocolate Cake Simple White Cake Quick and Easy Brownies sanzoe How to Store Chocolate Frosting If you have leftover frosting after frosting your cake, store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week. You can freeze leftover chocolate frosting for up to three months.  Learn more: How to Store a Frosted Cake Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “This was quick and easy, tasted great, fluffy, and perfect for a 13x9-inch pan,” raves Jane W. “No complicated ingredients.” “I'll never buy icing from the store again,” says Serena. “This is a great recipe.” “So easy with ingredients most have on hand,” according to Shelly. “Tastes delish! Use less milk to make it firmer for decorating.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 20 servings ⅔ cup cocoa powder ½ cup salted butter, melted 3 cups confectioners' sugar 5 tablespoons milk plus more if needed 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk cocoa powder and warm melted butter together in a large bowl; let sit for 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add confectioners sugar, 5 tablespoons milk, and vanilla extract. Beat with an electric mixer until well blended, smooth, and creamy, about 2 minutes, adding 1 or 2 tablespoons more milk as needed to get to desired consistency. Add Your Photo Photos of Homemade Chocolate Frosting 01 of 13 Photo by  sanzoe 02 of 13 Photo by  IcyToast2460 01/20/2024 This was the most repulsive thing I’ve ever tasted. It was the most traumatic experience. Used every ounce of milk and it still didn’t work. Used our family’s life savings to make this cake for my daughters wedding. Ruined everything! 03 of 13 Photo by  SneakyPecan5122 01/14/2024 Simple and easy! Very tasty! This will be my quick go to for chocolate frosting from now on. The pic is the frosting freshly blended. 04 of 13 Photo by  Lela 10/31/2023 Such an easy tasty recipe to make. I made a 9x13 yellow cake and the frosting was just enough to frost the cake. 05 of 13 Photo by  sanzoe 10/25/2023 This was an excellent rich chocolate frosting. I did have to add a bit more milk to thin it out a bit but overall it was a nice texture and taste. I used it to fill some macarons I had made. 06 of 13 Photo by  Lindsay 10/19/2023 I really like the flavor of this frosting. It is super easy to make too. The frosting is silky, I think from the melted butter. It was the perfect amount for my 9x13 cake. I would recommend it, and would definitely make it again. 07 of 13 Photo by  SneakyGhee7182 03/09/2023 I was so surprised how easy this was to make!! i didn't even have to use a mixer, i just mixed it real good by hand with a fork. I did use margarine instead of butter, and i found that i only needed 3 spoons of milk, not the 7 recommended. This recipe was enough to stick together and Mostly coat a 3-layer 9x9 cake! 08 of 13 Photo by  Belle Amie 02/08/2022 Very Good! If you want a Deadly Chocolate Experience, add this to the One Bowl Chocolate Cake III recipe by shirleyo. To make sure I had enough Frosting for my layer cake, I doubled this recipe. I had a little too much Frosting, but I put it on my cake anyway! 09 of 13 Photo by  Betty Dickson 03/10/2021 The only thing I did different from the recipe was I used 1/3 cup Hershey's Special Dark Cocoa and 1/3 cup of a regular cocoa. I was low on the dark cocoa. I also threw in a tsp. if instant coffee I ground to a powder. This is an incredibly tasty recipe. I did whip it a bit too much. I got distracted while it was whipping so it had a lot of air bubbles when I went to spread it. I was able to work them out for the most part though. I cannot wait to make it again with all dark cocoa. This will be my go to chocolate frosting from now on. 10 of 13 Photo by  Kay 07/10/2020 Oh my goodness… This is absolutely delicious!! It is so fast and easy Which makes it yummyness even more fantastic!!
